item.title: Configure phpMyAdmin to access multiple servers
item.description: By default, phpMyAdmin allows us to connect to local MySQL server only. But we may need to access multiple database servers from our single phpMyAdmin. It’s such an easy job. For each new server, we will just need to create a new config file (with .php extension) in /etc/phpmyadmin/conf.d directory. lets create a new server sudo nano /etc/phpmyadmin/conf.d/second-server.php <?php $cfg['Servers'][2]['verbose'] = 'Database Server #2'; $cfg['Servers'][2]['host'] = 'DB_HOST'; $cfg['Servers'][2]['user'] = 'DB_USERNAME'; $cfg['Servers'][2]['password'] = 'DB_PASSWORD'; That’s it!
